intro: Stenocalyx costatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hakea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, hard seeds. Stenocalyx costatus is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
